WRITING.TITLE: Turning radius
WRITING.TEXT: I haven't seen it discussed anywhere else. I've been mostly using light characters because of how sharply they turn. I'd love to get used to the speedier characters but they can't turn as sharply. What stat governs this? All the discussion about the weight classes only mentions speed vs. acceleration as if they all turn just as well.

"Moo Moo Meadows is essentially what happens when you rely on depression era structures to accommodate the rigors of modern-day transit."

The way I see it they must make a Wii Sports Resort sequel. I honestly can't believe it's not announced already. To this day, I still play it regularly with my casual gaming friends. Nintendo has such a wealth of IPs that I guess they have forgotten about Wii Sports for now, but it would sell massively and move Switches without a doubt. Wikipedia says the original sold 80 million copies... I know at least half of those were pack ins, but people bought the Wii specifically to play it, so I'd say that counts as a sale. Third all time and bigger seller than Mario. I know it's popular around here to trash it, but it is a masterpiece in my opinion. Wii Sports Resort improved upon it and still sells for $60 as it is hard to find. Wii Sports Club had potential but they got too cute with the marketing when they split each game into a separate purchase. Also, the relative failure of the Wii U meant it was nearly impossible to find an online game. Switch Sports would be at least as big as Mario Kart 8 Deluxe and Splatoon 2 are about to be. It's a slam dunk if you're Nintendo. Side note: Do we have confirmation that the Joycons will work as a pointer like the Wiimote?

This is what the security guard showed me when I walked up. I already knew they weren't going to let me in, I just wanted to see what he would say. Fun walk over through south Kyoto from the Fushimi-Inari Shrine. And by the way that place, Mt. Inari, was the most fun I've had on this Japan trip. We walked all up in the woods for hours finding all these ancient shrines. Was a very BOTW experience and it clearly makes sense that Nintendo is from there.

Skyward Sword might have the best crafted dungeons in any Zelda. The overworld *was* limited, and you had to revisit the same areas, but I put those shortcomings on the hardware. I still really enjoyed it for what it was. Great music and story too. Also the motion controls always worked well for me.
